messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081
messages.msgSnippet: COuld you give me the name of these motion sickness tablets. I m assuming that they are NOT dramamine. My daughter gets motion sickness easy even on a
messages.messageBody:
COuld you give me the name of these motion sickness tablets. I'm assuming that they are NOT dramamine. My daughter gets motion sickness easy even on a relatively short bus ride around town. We will be needing these when we head to Oregon in June for her sisters HS graduation.
Jessica
 
Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana
http://www.stampinbookworm.eboard.com
-----Original Message-----
From: Collette Mattingly <collettemattingly@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Thursday, April 05, 2001 11:06 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081

Homeopathic motion sickness tablets were the only way I could move without puking the first trimester of my pregnancy.
----- Original Message -----
From: Tracy Oldfield
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, April 05, 2001 12:28 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081

Hi everyone! I'm a little behind on the posts, but I just wanted to
mention 
that with the homeopathics, they are quite safe no matter how
much you give 
to them. If you read up in any of the homeopathic handbooks, it
will tell 
you that after a certain dosage- say 4 every ten minutes in accute
cases, 
nothing more will happen. They could take 40 of them and you will
get the 
same results as 4 (4 of homeopathic anything in most cases is the
full 
strength it can go to). To prove this point, my dd has taken whole
bottles 
of homeopathic remedies (quite by accident!- but they taste
yummy!) and been 
just fine. You're just out the money if they get into them! I never
worry 
with the homeopathics. This is mainly what I use for dd, and for
myself. I 
find them to be very effective. Hope this helps.

Vic

Last year, someone on a gardening list (which is sadly no more,
does anyone know of a mostly-UK organic gardening email list?)
warning against the 'harmlessness' of homeopathy told the list
about her son, who'd been utterly bunged up with catarrh, taking a
homeopathic remedy, within 10 minutes his nose was literally
streaming (like a river) with goo, and within 20 minutes he was
completely clear.  The moral being that they might be 'safe' in
terms of dosage, but don't believe that they aren't very potent!

Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081
messages.msgSnippet: I have to ask you about your address Noni? My not quite two year old daughter calls her cousin Nory by Noni and her name is Victoria! Johanna ... From:
messages.messageBody:
I have to ask you about your address Noni? My not quite two year old daughter calls her cousin Nory by Noni and her name is Victoria!
Johanna
----- Original Message -----
From: noni411@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, April 04, 2001 4:01 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081

Hi everyone!  I'm a little behind on the posts, but I just wanted to mention
that with the homeopathics, they are quite safe no matter how much you give
to them.  If you read up in any of the homeopathic handbooks, it will tell
you that after a certain dosage- say 4 every ten minutes in accute cases,
nothing more will happen.  They could take 40 of them and you will get the
same results as 4 (4 of homeopathic anything in most cases is the full
strength it can go to).  To prove this point, my dd has taken whole bottles
of homeopathic remedies (quite by accident!- but they taste yummy!) and been
just fine. You're just out the money if they get into them!  I never worry
with the homeopathics.  This is mainly what I use for dd, and for myself. I
find them to be very effective. Hope this helps.

Vic

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081
messages.msgSnippet: Hi everyone!  I m a little behind on the posts, but I just wanted to mention that with the homeopathics, they are quite safe no matter how much you give to
messages.messageBody:
Hi everyone! I'm a little behind on the posts, but I just wanted to mention
that with the homeopathics, they are quite safe no matter how much you give
to them. If you read up in any of the homeopathic handbooks, it will tell
you that after a certain dosage- say 4 every ten minutes in accute cases,
nothing more will happen. They could take 40 of them and you will get the
same results as 4 (4 of homeopathic anything in most cases is the full
strength it can go to). To prove this point, my dd has taken whole bottles
of homeopathic remedies (quite by accident!- but they taste yummy!) and been
just fine. You're just out the money if they get into them! I never worry
with the homeopathics. This is mainly what I use for dd, and for myself. I
find them to be very effective. Hope this helps.

Vic

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081
messages.msgSnippet: Ah!!!!!  I thought you were selling your house to move.  I like having only what in mine too. Angela Unschooling mother in Maine to two beautiful daughters.
messages.messageBody:
Ah!!!!!  I thought you were selling your house to move.  I like having only what in mine too.

Angela
Unschooling mother in Maine to two beautiful daughters.
"Play is our brain's favorite way to learn."
Unknown
Check out my themestream articles.
www.themestream.com/gspd_browse/author/view_author_info.gsp?auth_id=152256
Angela's Home School
www.geocities.com/autonomousangela

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081
messages.msgSnippet: Well, me too. But until I said something about it to this list, I thought I was all alone here with my non sleepingness and trying to do it quietly so as not
messages.messageBody:
Well, me too. But until I said something about it to
this list, I thought I was all alone here with my non
sleepingness and trying to do it quietly so as not
wake anyone else up. What if we all say magic words
for each other and YANK the toothpicks out of each
others eyes really quick and see what happens.
cybersleep. there ought to be such a thing. You could
plug in, charge up, rest up, and not have to actually
PUT yourself to sleep as though you were a child.
I'm going to invent it. Who's with me?
-Bobbie

--- RValvo7626@... wrote:
> In a message dated 4/2/01 7:44:39 PM Mountain
> Daylight Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
> << K, sorry to ramble on and on,
> but it is actually really comforting to me to see
> other people who ..well...think alot. :) and don't
> fall asleep after counting three and saying the
> magic
> word. I love it. >>
>
> Oh, but how I wish I could. I need more sleep
> NOW. I feel like a
> cartoon right now w/ dry eyes that feel like they
> have had toothpicks holding
> them open. Really it is my nervous mind.
>
> NICKI~
>


__________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/2/01 7:44:39 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/2/01 7:44:39 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< K, sorry to ramble on and on,
but it is actually really comforting to me to see
other people who ..well...think alot. :) and don't
fall asleep after counting three and saying the magic
word. I love it. >>

Oh, but how I wish I could. I need more sleep NOW. I feel like a
cartoon right now w/ dry eyes that feel like they have had toothpicks holding
them open. Really it is my nervous mind.

NICKI~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1081
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/2/01 7:44:39 PM Mountain Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/2/01 7:44:39 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Oh, I don't know how you could move from a farm home to a condo! And
believe it or not, I love the chores. They get me out of the house into the
fresh air bright and early in the morning. (OK, OK, when it is 30 below and
the wind is blowing 50 miles an hour, I whine all the way to the barn) But
overall, the plusses outway the minuses.
Angela >>

If it weren't a caretaking position I would be staying believe me.
But, if I cannot have my own working farm I don't want one. I speak from 25
years of experience. I have run my own small place and worked for many barns,
small and large. Now if it isn't mine to run i don't even want a yard. :o)

NICKI~ ..........my mother feels the same way and she is still running
her own barn. If we can't have it all we don't want a piece of it.
